page.title: 11EARSDON CONSERVATION AREA
page.content: Earsdon Conservatin Area.Earsdon-from the odd name ERDEJDUN(Hill of Red Earth).A conservation area is one designated by the Local Authority as being of special architectural or historical interset.Earsdon has been a conservation area since 1975.It is protected from any alteration which would destroy its charactor.Most of the village is residential.The oldest building is the Manor House.Tyne&Wear County Council give grants for repairs to old buildings.No one can demolish any buildings or fell trees without permission.The Local Authority have powers to prosecute anyone who does. New development is behind the Red Lion where 5 bungalows and 2 houses are being built.Some mature trees have been felled,but they must be replaced by new ones somewhere in the village.
